## Interactive Histogram App

This is an interactive histogram where you can adjust the number of bins to see how the histogram changes.

### Controls

Use the slider to adjust the number of bins.

```{r}
library(shiny)
library(ggplot2)

# Define UI for the app
ui <- fluidPage(
  # Application title
  titlePanel("Interactive Histogram with Adjustable Bins"),
  
  # Sidebar layout with input and output definitions
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      # Slider input for the number of bins
      sliderInput("bins",
                  "Number of bins:",
                  min = 1,
                  max = 50,
                  value = 30)
    ),
    
    # Show the plot
    mainPanel(
      plotOutput("histPlot")
    )
  )
)

# Define server logic required to draw a histogram
server <- function(input, output) {
  
  # Render the histogram based on user input
  output$histPlot <- renderPlot({
    ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg)) +
      geom_histogram(bins = input$bins, fill = "skyblue", color = "black") +
      labs(title = "Histogram of Miles per Gallon (mpg)",
           x = "Miles per Gallon", y = "Count")
  })
}

# Run the application
shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
